name: Sauerkraut Soup II
author: Terrilyn Singleton
summary: This is a wonderful recipe I learned while in college. Serve with a nice crusty bread.  You can make this on the stove or in a slow cooker, whichever one fits your lifestyle. Just make sure you have a 4 quart size slow cooker. Note: to make this soup less fattening omit the cream of chicken soup and one of the cans of water.
ingredients: 1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 (10.75 ounce) can  condensed cream of chicken soup
1 pound smoked sausage of your choice, sliced
directions: In a 4 to 6 quart slow cooker, blend the cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, water, and chicken broth
Stir in sauerkraut, onion, carrots, potatoes, and sausage
Cover, and cook on High for 4 hours, or Low for up to 8 hours
Taste, and season with salt and pepper to your liking
